alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Evans (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bulloch and Evans. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Claxton to Brooklet, moving north. As much as 1 to 2 inches of rain has already fallen in some areas this evening. An additional to 1 to locally 2 inches will be possible through 930 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Statesboro, Claxton, Brooklet, Hagan, Daisy, Bellville, Denmark, Nevils, Leefield, Stilson, Emit, Overbrook, Edna, Grimshaw, Pretoria, Akins, Arcola, Claxton Evans County Airport and Gwinetts Crossing.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
